hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Aslam: The Prophet ﷺ said to Aslam: Fast this day. They said: We have already eaten. He said: Then fast the remainder of your day, meaning the day of Ashura, and whoever said it was from his father.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Anis ibn Sireen: The Prophet ﷺ used to command fasting on the white days - the thirteenth, fourteenth, and fifteenth (of the lunar month), and he would say: Fasting all the year round, or like the fasting of all the year

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Al-Muharrish from Banu Saad: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ set out from al-Jiaranah intending to perform Umrah at night, then he came down in the morning as if he had camped. I saw his back as if it were a piece of silver. [Second chain]: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ performed Umrah from al-Jiaranah at night and came down at al-Jiaranah in the morning as if he had camped, then when the sun declined he traveled in the valley of Sarif until he came to the main road.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Jundub ibn Abdullah al-Azdi: I traveled with him to Basra until we came to a place called the Poor Man's House. He asked: Did you used to recite the Quran with anyone? I said: Yes. He said: When you come to Basra, bring them to me with gray hair. So I brought him Salih ibn Masruh, Abu Bilal, Najdah, and Nafi ibn al-Azraq. He began to narrate to them from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. Jundub said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: The first part of a person that becomes rotten is his belly, and let none of you put anything in his belly except that which is good. And the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: The parable of a scholar who teaches people good but forgets himself is like a lamp that illuminates for people but burns itself. And the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Let not stand between any of you and Paradise while you are looking at its gates, a handful of Muslim blood shed wrongfully. The people spoke and mentioned enjoining good and forbidding evil, while he was silent. Then he said: I have never seen people more deserving of salvation if they are truthful.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by (through) Abu Thabit: The Prophet ﷺ would fast the Day of Ashura and encourage its fasting. When Ramadan came, he abandoned it and fasted Ramadan.
